page.title: 04PHEASANT FARM
page.content: There is a pheasant farm in Blenheim park. The gamekeeper showed us elastic bands attached to the wings of the pheasants,to stop them flying up.They peck each others feathers to get the protien from the tips. The pheasants are moved to a fresh piece of grass every two days to stop them getting dirty. The pheasants lay many eggs which are taken away, cleaned, and checked to see if they have any moisture which determines if it is worth trying to hatch them. They are put in a paddle incubater then into another incubater which tilts them every hour and then they are put in a still air incubater for the last four days of the twenty four days. There is a pheasant farm on the estate for game hunting and for income.
